verb.description: Claim or prove that (evidence or an accusation) is false.
examples: he had to rebut charges of acting for the convenience of his political friends

verb.description: Drive back or repel (a person or attack).

origin: Middle English (in the senses rebuke and repulse): from Anglo-Norman French rebuter, from Old French re- (expressing opposition) + boter to butt. Sense 1 (originally a legal use) dates from the early 19th century.
